citeinfo.title: Water quality and optical absorbance data for groundwater samples collected during 2010 to 2012 from select Principal Aquifers of the United States

descript.abstract: Water quality and optical absorbance data for journal article entitled, "The removal kinetics of dissolved organic matter and the optical clarity of groundwater" by Francis H. Chapelle, Yuan Shen, Eric W. Strom, and Ronald Benner.
descript.purpose: This study seeks an explanation for the nearly uniform optical clarity that characterizes groundwater in a variety of geologic media and under different hydrologic conditions. Whereas waters originating at land surface that recharges groundwater systems often contain high concentrations of CDOM, this CDOM is rapidly attenuated in the unsaturated zone overlying aquifers and in the saturated zone of the aquifers.

spdom.descgeog: Groundwater wells in Connecticut, Georgia, Nebraska, South Carolina, Texas, and Utah

cntperp.cntorg: U.S. Geological Survey, South Atlantic Water Science Center

idinfo.datacred: USGS Toxics Substances Hydrology Program (TSHP); National Water Quality Program (NWQP), National Water Quality Assessment Project (NAWQA)

attracc.attraccr: No formal attribute accuracy tests were conducted

dataqual.logic: No formal logical accuracy tests were conducted
dataqual.complete: Data set is considered complete for the information presented, as described in the abstract. Users are advised to read the rest of the metadata record carefully for additional details.

horizpa.horizpar: No formal positional accuracy tests were conducted

vertacc.vertaccr: No formal positional accuracy tests were conducted

method.methdesc: Concentrations of DOC were measured using high-temperature combustion via a Shimadzu TOC-V analyzer (Benner and Strom, 1993). Milli-Q UV-Plus water was injected every 6th sample as a blank and the blanks were negligible. Absorbance spectra (200-800 nm) of water samples were determined using a dual-beam Shimadzu 1601 spectrophotometer and 10-cm quartz cuvettes. For high-absorbance samples, 1-cm quartz cuvettes were used. Absorbances were corrected for blank (the average absorbance between 690 and 700 nm) and were converted to Napierian absorption coefficients aλ (m-1) according to the equation: aλ = 2.303 Aλ/r where Aλ is the absorbance measured across pathlength r at a wavelength λ (254 nm).

citeinfo.origin: Y Shen, FH Chapelle, EW Strom, R Benner
citeinfo.title: Origins and bioavailability of dissolved organic matter in groundwater

enttyp.enttypd: Site information and water quality data
enttyp.enttypds: USGS National Water Quality Assessment Project

attr.attrdef: Sample collection and site data corresponding to column headings Location ID, Sample ID, Station No., Date

attrdomv.udom: Location ID, Sample ID, Station No., sample collection date

attr.attrdef: Water quality data corresponding to column headings DOC (umol/L), TDN (umol/L), ag (254) (/m), ag (350) (/m), S275-295 (/nm), SUVA254 (L/mg/m), ag (350)/DOC (L/mmol/m), L-Asp DLAA (nmole/L), D-Asp DLAA (nmole/L), L-Glu DLAA (nmole/L), D-Glu DLAA (nmole/L), L-Ser DLAA (nmole/L), D-Ser DLAA (nmole/L), L-His DLAA (nmole/L), L-Thr DLAA (nmole/L), Gly DLAA (nmole/L), L-Arg DLAA (nmole/L), beta-Ala DLAA (nmole/L), L-Ala DLAA (nmole/L), gaba-Aba DLAA (nmole/L), D-Ala DLAA (nmole/L), L-Tyr DLAA (nmole/L), L-Val DLAA (nmole/L), L-Phe DLAA (nmole/L), L-Ileu DLAA (nmole/L), L-Leu DLAA (nmole/L), L-Lys DLAA (nmole/L), Total AA DLAA (nmole/L), AA yield (%DOC)

attrdomv.udom: Water quality parameters in concentration units as define in the column headers 5-33
